Posts.Content: my diagnosis, lumpectomy and radiotherapy went past in such a rush, and I did cope really well.  We also had a houseful of builders which added to the stress.  Once it was all over and the builders had gone, that's when I got weepy and started to feel emotionally vulnerable.  Anyone have any tips on how to get through this period? Thank you.
Posts.Title: Post cancer feelings

Posts.Content: Thank you !  Feel much better knowing this is a normal reaction.  Struggle to work yet how much is me and how much is the hormone meds.
Posts.Title: Post cancer feelings

Posts.Content: Thank you !  All the time I was going through treatment I thought I was a fraud - yes, it was cancer, but it hadn't spread, and my wounds healed up beautifully, and even my radiation burn cleared up - I had had it easy.  Yet I still feel like I've been through an emotional wringer ..........xx
Posts.Title: Post cancer feelings

Posts.Content: So much support and understanding !  Like Elauns, I constantly thought how easy I had had it compared to other people, so I had no right to be tearful.  But now I know better and I will look at the Moving Forward course.  Thanks again everyone xx
Posts.Title: Post cancer feelings

Posts.Content: Good advice.  I am trying to regain control through exercise and my social life.  Luckily I am retired so don't have work to worry about.  I am only in month two after treatment, so think I am maybe expecting too much.   jackie x
Posts.Title: Post cancer feelings
